|order = |office = [[Ministry of the Interior (Afghanistan)|Interior Minister]] |term_start = 1 September 2013 |term_end = December 2014 |president = [[Hamid Karzai]] |predecessor = [[Ghulam Mujtaba Patang]] |successor = [[Mohammad Ayub Salangi]] <small>(acting)</small>
|order2 = |office2 = [[Afghanistan|Afghan]] [[Ambassador]] to [[Pakistan]] |term_start2 = 18 April 2011 |term_end2 = 31 August 2013 |predecessor2 = |successor2 =
|order4 = |office4 = [[Afghanistan|Afghan]] [[Chief of Staff]] |term_start4 = 2007 |term_end4 = April 2011 |president4 = Hamid Karzai |predecessor4 = [[Jawed Ludin]] |successor4 =
|order5 = |office5 = [[Afghanistan|Afghan]] [[Ambassador]] to [[Iran]] |term_start5 = 2005 |term_end5 = 2007 |predecessor5 = [[Mohammad Najibullah]] |successor5 = [[Yahya Maroofi]]
|order6 = |office6 = [[Afghanistan|Afghan]] [[Chief of Staff]] |term_start6 = 2003 |term_end6 = 2005 |predecessor6 = [[Said Tayeb Jawad]] |successor6 = Jawed Ludin
|birth_date = October 12, 1957 |birth_place = Qarabagh District, Kabul |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = |nationality = Afghan |party = Independent, Former [[Hezbi Islami]] |spouse = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = |occupation = Politician, Diplomat, Former Aid Worker |profession = |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |religion = Islam |signature = |signature_alt = |website = |footnotes = }}
'''Mohammad Umer Daudzai''' ({{lang-ps|محمد عمر داودزی}} - born October 12, 1957) is a [[Politics of Afghanistan|Politician]] in [[Afghanistan]], most recently having served as the [[Ministry of the Interior (Afghanistan)|Minister of Interior]] during the challenging [[Afghan presidential election, 2014|2014 electoral year]]. After a career with international non-governmental organizations including the [[United Nations Development Program]] in [[Geneva]], Daudzai started work as two term [[Chief of Staff]] of [[President of Afghanistan|Afghan President]] [[Hamid Karzai]] from 2003 to 2005 and then from 2007 to around 2010. From 2005 until 2007, President Karzai appointed him as Afghan [[Ambassador]] in [[Afghanistan–Iran relations|Iran]]. He then served as Afghan Ambassador to [[Afghanistan–Pakistan relations|Pakistan]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/524228/omer-daudzai-emerges-as-strong-candidate-to-replace-karzai/|title=Omer Daudzai emerges as strong candidate to replace Karzai}}</ref> tasked with advancing efforts to reach a political solutions to the war in Afghanistan. In September 2013, Daudzai was asked to serve as [[Ministry of the Interior (Afghanistan)|Afghan Minister of the Interior]] in [[Kabul]] and instead ensure security for the elections.<ref>{{cite web|last=Khan |first=Tahir |url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/524228/omer-daudzai-emerges-as-strong-candidate-to-replace-karzai/ |title=Omer Daudzai emerges as strong candidate to replace Karzai - The Express Tribune |publisher=Tribune.com.pk |date= |accessdate=2015-11-23}}</ref>
Daudzai has left official office and continues to work in Afghanistan's politics through supporting youth groups, and mobilizing politically influentials people and organizations in support of strengthening the country's democratic order. He has also emerged as a critic of President [[Ashraf Ghani]]'s unbalanced regional diplomacy and pursuit of unilateral closeness to Pakistan—arguing in a NYT oped that "rather than expect a miraculous U-turn from Islamabad, Mr. Ghani’s government would do better to use its resources, and the international community’s continued support, to concentrate on its main purpose: consolidating the Afghan state."<ref name="nytimes1">[https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/23/opinion/afghanistan-and-pakistan-the-false-promise-of-rapprochement.html]</ref><ref name="nytimes1"/>
==Early life and education== Daudzai was born on 12 October 1957 in the [[Qarabagh District, Kabul|Qarabagh District]] of the [[Kabul Province]] in Afghanistan. He grew up and completed his primary education in his home district of Qarabagh. In order to continue his higher education, Omar moved to the capital city [[Kabul]].
==80s and 90s: Anti-Soviet Jihad and Association with Hezbi Islami== During the 1980s Daudzai became active in the resistance against the [[Soviet–Afghan War|Soviet-occupation]] and joined the [[Mujahideen]] group of [[Gulbuddin Hekmatyar]]: [[Hezbi Islami]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/24/world/asia/24afghan.html?pagewanted=2&_r=2 |title=Iran Is Said to Give Top Karzai Aide Cash by the Bagful (Page 2 of 2)|first=Dexter |last=Filkins |publisher=The New York Times|location=United States|date=October 23, 2010|accessdate=2010-10-24}}</ref> While still influential with the former cadre of Hebi Islami who are active in Afghanistan's politics, Daudzai has ended his official ties with the party reportedly after the Soviet withdrawal in 1989 and remains politically independent.
==1996-2003: UN Employee== During the Taliban era Daudzai decided to settle in [[Peshawar]], Pakistan, and began working for the organization [[Save the Children]]. While working there through a scholarship program, he was able to go to the [[Victoria University (United Kingdom)|Victoria University]] in the [[United Kingdom]] for his Masters in Science. After completing his Masters he came back to work for the Swedish Committee in [[Jalalabad]], Afghanistan. In 1996 he moved to [[Islamabad]], Pakistan, where he started working for the [[United Nations Development Program]] (UNDP). In 2001 he moved to [[Geneva]], [[Switzerland]], where he assumed the role of "Area Development Specialist" in UNDP Geneva.
==2003-2005: Afghan Chief of Staff== In November 2003 Daudzai was approached by the [[Afghan Transitional Administration]] to assume the office of the Chief of Staff of the President and took the position. At that time, the key challenge was establishing the Afghan state amidst an environment full of traditional power holders and illegal militias. Commenting on how only few militias have disarmed, he said: "Any force not part of the Afghan National Army is a challenge, but this is reality, so we ought to deal with it diplomatically and peacefully. I hope we will succeed."<ref name="Al-Ahram">[http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2004/699/in5.htm Al-Ahram Weekly: Waiting for Godot] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090910115117/http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2004/699/in5.htm |date=September 10, 2009 }}</ref>
Daudzai served as Hamid Karzai's Chief of Staff until 2005<ref name=NYT-2>{{cite web|url=http://archives.tcm.ie/irishexaminer/2004/06/21/story23336867.asp |accessdate=September 4, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101027170444/http://archives.tcm.ie/irishexaminer/2004/06/21/story23336867.asp |archivedate=October 27, 2010 }}</ref> when he moved to [[Tehran]] as the [[Foreign relations of Afghanistan|Afghan Ambassador]] to [[Iran]].<ref>http://www.tehrantimes.com/PDF/10371/10371-16.pdf</ref>
==2007-2011: Return as Chief of Staff== In 2007, he replaced Jawed Ludin and resumed the position of the Chief of Staff for Afghan President Hamid Karzai.
===Peace Talks and the Taliban Imposer Episode=== In the summer of 2010, outside Daudzai's influence, Karzai sat down with a man believed to be former [[Taliban]] Cabinet minister [[Akhtar Muhammad Mansour]] to discuss peace between the Taliban and the Afghan Government. According to Daudzai, it later turned out the man wasn't Mansour at all, but an imposter who was just a shopkeeper in [[Quetta]]. Daudzai blamed the [[United Kingdom|British]] for this debacle, because he said that they brought the man in front of Karzai. "International partners should not get excited so quickly with those kinds of things," Daudzai said, adding that the incident shows that the Afghan peace talks should be "Afghan-led and fully Afghanized."<ref name="cbcnews">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2010/11/26/world/main7092313.shtml |title=CBS: Afghans Blame British for Taliban Imposter |publisher=Cbsnews.com |date=2010-11-26 |accessdate=2015-11-23}}</ref> According to Wikileaks Cables Daudzai also believed that the [[Norway|Norwegian]]s might have been fooled into meeting self-proclaimed members of the Taliban who may in fact not have been Taliban members at all. Daudzai claimed that he had never heard anything about contact between the Taliban and Norwegian authorities.<ref name="newsinenglish.no">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.newsinenglish.no/2011/01/31/wikileaks-norway-talked-to-taliban/ |title=Aftenposten: WikiLeaks: Norway talked to Taliban |publisher=Newsinenglish.no |date=2011-01-31 |accessdate=2015-11-23}}</ref>
The Atlantic profiled him as:<ref>{{cite web|author=Mujib Mashal is an Afghan writer based in Kabul. |url=https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2014/06/the-men-who-run-afghanistan/373197/ |title=The Men Who Run Afghanistan |publisher=The Atlantic |date=2014-06-23 |accessdate=2015-11-23}}</ref> "A soft-spoken former aid worker, Daudzai served as the president’s liaison to the many warlords and strongmen he had to keep in check—both to ensure stability and to secure his reelection in 2009. While Daudzai was once associated with the conservative Hizb-e-Islami party, the 56-year-old...is more pragmatic in his worldview. When Karzai made an ultimately unsuccessful push for reconciliation with the Taliban in 2011, he dispatched Daudzai as his ambassador to Pakistan. To express his displeasure with the Americans, who tried to oust him during his 2009 reelection campaign, Karzai replaced Daudzai as chief of staff with Abdul Karim Khurram, a conservative former culture minister with an anti-American reputation."
===Cash Aid from Iran to Hamid Karzai's Office=== In 2010, there were rumors that then President Hamid Karzai's office was receiving bags filled with cash from Iranian officials. Karzai acknowledged and accepted the fact that the [[Politics of Iran|Government of Iran]] has been providing millions of dollars directly to his office. Karzai told reporters he had instructed Daudzai to accept the money from Tehran. "It is official and by my order," Karzai said.<ref name="omaha">Riechman, D. [http://www.omaha.com/article/20100310/AP15/303109986 Karzai says his office gets cash from Iran, US] Omaha, 10-3-2010</ref> Iranians also stated that the report was indeed true. Two weeks after the controversy about the Iranian money Daudzai came out to the Afghan Media for an open interview. In the interview Daudzai showed piles of files that proved that every cent of the money coming from Iran were spent on government expenses only and that he had record for all the money that came from Iran. He also claimed that Iranian money had been coming to Afghanistan since 2002 but the issue was brought out only now in order to pressure the Karzai government for political reasons<ref>[https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101026/ap_on_re_as/as_afghan_iran_11 Karzai says his office gets cash from Iran, US] {{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref><ref>[https://news.yahoo.com/s/csm/20101026/wl_csm/334638_1 Karzai's acknowledgement of bags of Iranian cash: Why now?]{{dead link|date=November 2015}}</ref><ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/26/world/asia/26karzai.html?partner=rss&emc=rss Karzai Rails Against America in Diatribe]</ref> and that since 2002 also the US, the UK and Japan had provided the presidential office with cash assistance.<ref name="nationaltvafghanistan">[http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=NewsLibrary&p_multi=BBAB&d_place=BBAB&p_theme=newslibrary2&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=1334F9D537187248&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM West intensifies pressure on Afghan president through media - official] National Afghanistan TV, 5-11-2010</ref> According to Newsweek, nearly every encounter between Afghan and Iranian officials ends up with the Iranians proffering a sack of cash.<ref name="newsweek">Yousafzai, S. & Moreau, R.[http://www.newsweek.com/2010/10/30/iranians-ties-to-afghan-pols-run-deep.html Sacks of Cash] Newsweek, 30-10-2010</ref>
According to [[wikileaks cables]] Daudzai told deputy US ambassador Francis Ricciardone already in February 2010 that certain Afghan officials were on Tehran's payroll, including some people nominated for cabinet positions. Daudzai claimed that some of these officials had been relieved of their duties because 'you can't be an honest Afghan if you receive a package from Iran.'<ref name="oneindia">[http://news.oneindia.in/2010/12/03/iranfunding-afghan-religious-political-leaders-talibanmil.html Iran funding Afghan religious-political leaders, Taliban militants: WikiLeaks] One India, 3-12-2010</ref> Daudzai had told Ricciardone, and he said that his government preferred the US' sustained cash support to the 'occasional and unpredictable' payments from Iran.<ref name="buisnessweek">[http://www.businessweek.com/ap/financialnews/D9JSA24G0.htm WikiLeaks: Bribery, graft rampant in Afghanistan] AP, 3-12-2010</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{AfghanDiplomats}}

{{refimprove|date=May 2015}}{{Infobox television episode | title = Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics | series = South Park | image = | caption = Jesus and Santa Claus sing. | season = 3 | episode = 15 | airdate = December 1, 1999 | production = 315 | writer = Trey Parker | director = [[Trey Parker]] | guests = | season_article = South Park (season 3) | episode_list = List of South Park episodes | season_list = | prev = [[The Red Badge of Gayness]] | next = [[Are You There God? It's Me, Jesus]] }} "'''Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics'''" is the fifteenth episode of the [[South Park (season 3)|third season]] of the animated television series ''[[South Park]]''. An [[album]] of the same name consisting of versions of songs from the show as well as a number of additional songs was released the week prior to the episode's original air date, December 1, 1999. ==Reception== In September 2008, Russian prosecutors filed a motion to ban the series based on complaints received about this episode.{{cite news| title =Bid to ban "extremist" U.S. cartoon| url =https://www.reuters.com/article/oddlyEnoughNews/idUSL869731820080908|work =| publisher= [[Reuters]]|date = 2008-09-08|accessdate = 2008-10-23}} The TV station was allowed to keep its license by agreeing not to re-air the program.{{cite book|last=Dobson|first=William J.|title=The Dictator's Learning Curve: Inside the Global Battle for Democracy|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=YpK7opoaY6wC&pg=PT171|accessdate=9 May 2015|date=2012-06-05|publisher=Knopf Doubleday Publishing Group|isbn=9780385533362|pages=171–}} [[Ted Gournelos]] called "Merry Fucking Christmas" as sung by Mr. Garrison, "ridiculously offensive".{{cite book|last=Gournelos|first=Ted|title=Popular Culture and the Future of Politics: Cultural Studies and the Tao of South Park|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MSs2AAAAQBAJ&pg=PA65|accessdate=9 May 2015|date=2009-09-30|publisher=Lexington Books|isbn=9780739137222|pages=65–}} == Episode == The episode is styled as a [[variety show]] and features [[Mr. Hankey]] as the host;{{cite book|last1=Ariano|first1=Tara|last2=Bunting|first2=Sarah D.|title=Television Without Pity: 752 Things We Love to Hate (and Hate to Love) about TV|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=cm28udLiQlkC&pg=PA169|accessdate=9 May 2015|year=2006|publisher=Quirk Books|isbn=9781594741173|pages=169–}} he sits by the fire in his sewer home and introduces shorts featuring unusual holiday songs. In a similar fashion to "[[Starvin' Marvin in Space]]", the episode was dedicated to [[Mary Kay Bergman]], the original voice of most of the female characters on the show up to that point, who had committed suicide less than a month earlier. Since the episode features audio from the ''Christmas Classics'' album, which had been recorded months earlier, it marks the final episode in which Bergman's voice is heard. During the "Christmas Time in Hell" song Satan is singing along with various celebrities in Hell, including [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], [[John F. Kennedy]], [[John F. Kennedy, Jr.]], [[Diana, Princess of Wales]], [[Gene Siskel]], [[Mao Zedong]], [[Genghis Khan]], [[Michael Landon]] and [[Jimmy Stewart]]. A framed picture of comedian [[Andy Dick]] is also seen during the dance number. === Songs/scenes === # "Mr. Hankey The Christmas Poo", performed by a postman, Mr. Hankey and the students of South Park Elementary (students voiced by the voice actors of [[Ike Broflovski]]) # "[[I Have a Little Dreidel|Dreidel, Dreidel, Dreidel (The Dreidel Song)]]", performed by [[Kyle Broflovski]], with [[Eric Cartman]], [[Stan Marsh]], and [[Gerald and Sheila Broflovski|Gerald, Sheila]] and Ike Broflovski # "[[O Tannenbaum]]", performed by [[Adolf Hitler (South Park)|Adolf Hitler]] # "Christmas Time In Hell", performed by [[Satan (South Park)|Satan]] and the damned # "[[Carol of the Bells]]", performed by [[Mr. Mackey]] # "[[O Holy Night]]", incorrectly performed by [[Eric Cartman]]{{cite book|last=Werts|first=Diane|title=Christmas on Television|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=wHvScaUAk1oC&pg=PA178|accessdate=9 May 2015|year=2006|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=9780275983314|pages=178–}} # "Merry Fucking Christmas", performed by [[Herbert Garrison|Mr. Garrison]] # "[[I Saw Three Ships]]", performed by [[Randy and Sharon Marsh#Family|Shelley Marsh]] # A Christmas medley performed by [[Jesus (South Park)|Jesus]] and [[Santa Claus (South Park)|Santa Claus]] as [[Lounge music|lounge singers]], featuring: "[[Joy to the World]]", "[[Up On the House Top]]", "[[Away in a Manger]]", "[[O Come All Ye Faithful]]", "[[Hark! The Herald Angels Sing]]", "[[Silent Night (song)|Silent Night]]", "[[Rio (song)|Rio]]", and "[[Let it Snow]]" # "[[Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas]]", performed by Mr. Hankey and the cast. During the scene, Kenny is killed when a chandelier falls on him. # During the ending credits a reprise of "Dreidel Dreidel Dreidel" plays. === "Fighting the frizzies, at eleven." === After every commercial break, a live action segment featuring a news anchor is shown, saying "Fighting the frizzies, at eleven." In the DVD commentary, Stone and Parker indicate this is a reference to a bootleg tape of ''[[Star Wars Holiday Special]]''. The original tape featured a brief clip at the end from [[WCBS-TV]] featuring newscaster [[Rolland Smith]] informing viewers, "Fighting the frizzies, at eleven." However, while the original news ad was apparently referring to "frizzy" hair, the ending credits of this episode of ''South Park'' feature the news anchor boxing a man in a giant fuzzy suit.''The Complete South Park Season 3'' DVD == Album == {{Infobox album | italic_title = no | name = South Park: Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics | type = soundtrack | artist = Various Artists | cover = Mrhankeyschrismasclassicscover.jpg | alt = | released = November 23, 1999 | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = Comedy, Christmas Music | length = 36:34 | label = [[Columbia Records|Columbia]]
[[American Recordings (record label)|American Recordings]] | producer = [[Rick Rubin]] ([[Executive producer#Music|exec.]])
[[Marc Shaiman]], [[Matt Stone]], [[Trey Parker]] | chronology = ''[[South Park]]'' | prev_title = [[South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut (soundtrack)|South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut]] | prev_year = 1999 | next_title = | next_year = }} The album features more songs than the show. Additionally, some of those featured in the show are slightly different than the aired versions. The album reached #33 on Billboard's 1999 Christmas albums.{{cite book|last=Inc.|first=Nielsen Business Media,|title=Billboard|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=fxEEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA69|accessdate=9 May 2015|date=2000-09-16|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.|pages=69–}} {{track listing |extra_column = Performed by |title1 = Mr. Hankey The Christmas Poo |length1 = 2:16 |extra1 = Cowboy Timmy |writer1 = Trey Parker, Marc Shaiman |title2 = Merry Fucking Christmas |length2 = 2:04 |extra2 = Mr. Garrison |writer2 = Parker |title3 = O Holy Night |length3 = 1:57 |extra3 = Eric Cartman |writer3 = (Traditional) |title4 = Dead, Dead, Dead |length4 = 2:13 |extra4 = Juan Schwartz and the South Park Children's Choir |writer4 = Parker |title5 = Carol of the Bells |length5 = 0:57 |extra5 = Mr. Mackey |writer5 = Leontovich, Peter Wilhousky |title6 = The Lonely Jew on Christmas |length6 = 2:46 |extra6 = Kyle Broflofski |writer6 = Parker, Shaiman |title7 = I Saw Three Ships |length7 = 1:02 |extra7 = Shelley Marsh |writer7 = (Traditional) |title8 = [[It Happened in Sun Valley]] |length8 = 2:21 |extra8 = Stan Marsh and Wendy Testaburger |writer8 = Mack Gordon, Harry Warren |title9 = O Tannenbaum |length9 = 1:10 |extra9 = Adolf Hitler |writer9 = (Traditional) |title10 = Christmas Time in Hell |length10 = 2:15 |extra10 = Satan, The Dark Prince |writer10 = Parker, Shaiman |title11 = What the Hell Child is This? |length11 = 4:28 |extra11 = Chef |writer11 = (Traditional, adapted by Marc Shaiman) |title12 = Santa Claus is on His Way |length12 = 0:28 |extra12 = Mr. Hankey |writer12 = Parker |title13 = Swiss Colony Beef Log |length13 = 2:16 |extra13 = Cartman |writer13 = Parker, David Goodman |title14 = [[Hark! The Herald Angels Sing|Hark the Herald Angels Sing]] |length14 = 0:40 |extra14 = The South Park Children's Choir |writer14 = (Traditional) |title15 = Dreidel, Dreidel, Dreidel |length15 = 3:20 |extra15 = The Broflofskis with Eric Cartman and Stan Marsh |writer15 = (Traditional, adapted by Marc Shaiman) |title16 = The Most Offensive Song Ever |length16 = 3:00 |extra16 = Kenny McCormick and Mr. Hankey |writer16 = Parker, Shaiman |title17 = [[We Three Kings]] |length17 = 0:51 |extra17 = Mr. Ose |writer17 = (Traditional) |title18 = Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas |length18 = 2:30 |extra18 = Mr. Hankey with Stan, Kyle and Cartman |writer18 = Hugh Martin, Ralph Blaine }} ===Singles=== * "Mr. Hankey, The Christmas Poo" ; CD1 # "Mr. Hankey, The Christmas Poo" – Performed by Cowboy Timmy # "Cheesy Poofs (Theme)" – Performed by Eric Cartman # "Chocolate Salty Balls" (Karaoke Version) – Performed by [[Chef (South Park)|Chef]] ; CD2 # "Mr. Hankey, The Christmas Poo" – Performed by Cowboy Timmy # "My Best Friends" (Snippet) – Performed by Eric Cartman # "Swiss Colony Beef Log" – Performed by Eric Cartman == References == {{reflist|30em}} == External links == {{wikiquote}} * [http://www.southparkstudios.com/full-episodes/s03e15-mr-hankeys-christmas-classics Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics] Full episode at South Park Studios * [http://www.southparkstudios.com/guide/episodes/s03e15-mr-hankeys-christmas-classics Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics] Episode guide at South Park Studios * {{IMDb episode|0705944}} * {{Tv.com episode|2460}} {{South Park episodes|3}} {{South Park Christmas episodes}} [[Category:1999 Christmas albums]] [[Category:1999 soundtracks]] [[Category:1999 American television episodes]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of Adolf Hitler]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of Genghis Khan]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of Mao Zedong]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of John F. Kennedy]] [[Category:Albums produced by Rick Rubin]] [[Category:Christmas television episodes]] [[Category:Extremism]] [[Category:South Park (season 3) episodes]] [[Category:South Park albums]] [[Category:South Park songs]] [[Category:Television animation soundtracks]] [[Category:Hell in popular culture]]

revision.comment: BOT--Reverting link addition(s) by [[:en:Special:Contributions/188.5.186.170|188.5.186.170]] to revision 863829995 (www.facebook.com/NoBraDayOct19th [\bfacebook\.com])
revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox recurring event | name = No Bra Day | native_name = | logo = [[File:No Bra Day.jpg]] | logo_caption = No Bra Day October 13 | image = | imagesize = | caption = | alt = | date = October 13 (during [[National Breast Cancer Awareness Month]]) | frequency = Annual | location = World-wide | years_active = | established = {{start date|2011|07|09}} | website = {{url|https://www.facebook.com/NoBraDayOct13th |No Bra Day}} | footnotes = }} '''No Bra Day''' is an annual observance on [[October 13]] on which women are encouraged to forgo wearing a [[bra]] as a means to encourage [[breast cancer]] awareness. No Bra Day was initially observed on July 9, 2011, but within three years it had moved to October 13, the month of [[National Breast Cancer Awareness Month]]. Users on social media are encouraged to post using the hashtag #nobraday to promote awareness of breast cancer symptoms and to encourage [[gender equality]]. Some users on social media sites also encourage women to post pictures of themselves not wearing a bra. Some women embrace No Bra Day as a political statement while others prefer the comfort of discarding what they view as a restrictive, uncomfortable garment. The observance has spread worldwide. The event was spun off a medical event in Toronto, Canada, that encourages breast cancer survivors to consider [[reconstructive surgery]]. First held on October 19, 2011, the medical event was named BRA (Breast Reconstruction Awareness) Day. It was adapted by an anonymous individual who conceived of No Bra Day as a way to encourage women to enjoy being braless and to become knowledgeable about breast cancer symptoms. The day is controversial as some see it as sexualizing and exploiting women's bodies while at the same time belittling a serious disease. == Origins == === Event origins === The original event known as "BRA Day" was started by Toronto plastic surgeon Dr. Mitchell Brown. The first BRA Day event, titled "Breast Reconstruction – An Evening of Learning and Sharing", was held in Toronto, Canada at [[Women's College Hospital]] and [[Toronto General Hospital]] on October 19, 2011.{{cite web |title=Closing the loop on breast cancer |url=http://www.womenscollegehospital.ca/news-and-events/connect/news/closing-the-loop-on-breast-cancer |publisher = Women's College Hospital| website=www.womenscollegehospital.ca |accessdate=September 19, 2018}} Brown found that many Canadian women who underwent a [[mastectomy]] due to breast cancer resisted undergoing [[reconstructive surgery]]. He founded "Breast Reconstruction Awareness" (BRA) Day to increase women's awareness of the availability of [[Breast reconstruction|reconstructive breast surgery]].{{cite web |title=Toronto BRA Day Event Program – Toronto Plastic Surgery |url=https://www.torontoplasticsurgery.com/toronto-bra-day-event-program/ |website=Toronto Plastic Surgery |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |date=October 13, 2016}} BRA day is intended to raise awareness of [[breast cancer]] screening, alert women to breast cancer symptoms, and to encourage women to conduct regular self examinations. The event was adopted in the U.S. in 2012.{{cite web |title=National BRA Day |url=http://q961.com/the-history-of-the-bra-on-national-bra-day-photos/ |website=Q 96.1 |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |language=en}} {{asof|2018|9}}, the BRA Day event devoted to educating women about reconstructive surgery, and hosted by the [[Canadian Cancer Society]], continued to be held across Canada. BRA day is observed on different dates in different provinces of Canada during the month of October.{{cite web |title=Canadian Cancer Society |url=http://www.cancer.ca/en/support-and-services/support-services/bra-day/?region=bc |website=www.cancer.ca |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |language=en}} The origin of No Bra Day can be traced back to the first BRA Day held in Toronto, in 2011. In July that year, an anonymous individual using the name Anastasia Doughnuts conceived of No Bra Day and published the first website promoting the event.{{cite web |title=National No Bra Day |url=http://www.holidayscalendar.com/event/national-no-bra-day/ |website=Holidays Calendar |accessdate=September 21, 2018}}{{cite web |title=Happy National No Bra Day! Do Bras Make Breasts Sag And Vulnerable To Cancer? |url=https://www.inquisitr.com/1342831/happy-national-no-bra-day-do-bras-make-breasts-sag-and-vulnerable-to-cancer/ |website=The Inquisitr |accessdate=October 8, 2018 |date=July 9, 2014}} === Cultural genesis === Women have protested the physical and cultural restrictions imposed by bras over many years. In 1966, during the height of the [[hippie]] era in San Francisco, two women students at [[San Francisco State University|San Francisco State College]] protested a proposed law that would require women to wear bras by walking topless near the campus.{{cite web |title=FALSE: Hillary Clinton Went Topless in the 1960s |url=https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/hillary-clinton-topless-1960s/ |website=Snopes.com |accessdate=September 21, 2018}}{{cite web |title=Nude Fine Art Print from San Francisco State College, 1966 at Wolfgang's |url=https://www.wolfgangs.com/photography/nude/fine-art-print/GAP0008.html |website=Wolfgang's |accessdate=September 21, 2018 |language=en}} On August 1, 1969, an Anti-Bra Day was declared in San Francisco to protest societal pressure to wear constrictive, feminine garments. The protest drew large crowds, blocking traffic, and a few women took their bras off from under their clothing in the Financial District.{{cite web|url=https://diva.sfsu.edu/collections/sfbatv/bundles/231116|title=Anti-Bra Protest in Downtown San Francisco – Bay Area Television Archive|website=diva.sfsu.edu}}{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=svE1UqlqbWsC&pg=PA139|title=All the People|first=Joy|last=Hakim|date=September 10, 2018|publisher=Oxford University Press|via=Google Books}} In 1968, feminists organized [[Miss America protest|a protest]] at the [[Miss America Contest]] and tossed a number of feminine products in a garbage can. A newspaper headline erroneously stated that the women had burned their bras. That protest has been interpreted as a rejection of society's perception of women's bodies and dress requirements. During the 1970s women wore what they wanted without regard for political correctness. During the last two decades of the 20th century, bras expressed both professionalism and, due to the attention given a pink satin conical bra worn by [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], sexual freedom. == No Bra Day == === Beginnings in social media === The first No Bra Day event was created by an anonymous internet user self-named "Anastasia Doughnuts" for July 9, 2011{{cite web |last1=Weiss |first1=Piper |title=Today is National No Bra Day. But Why? |url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/blogs/fashion/today-national-no-bra-day-why-205500661.html |publisher=Yahoo News |accessdate=September 21, 2018 |date=July 9, 2012}} and was observed on that date through 2013.{{cite web |title=National No Bra Day: Empowering or Objectifying? |url=https://www.care2.com/causes/national-no-bra-day-empowering-or-objectifying.html |website=Care2 Causes |accessdate=September 21, 2018}} In 2013 and 2014, social media posts announced both July 9 and October 13 as No Bra Day.{{cite web |title=Happy National No Bra Day! Do Bras Make Breasts Sag And Vulnerable To Cancer? |url=https://www.inquisitr.com/1342831/happy-national-no-bra-day-do-bras-make-breasts-sag-and-vulnerable-to-cancer/ |website=The Inquisitr |accessdate=October 9, 2018 |date=July 9, 2014}}{{cite web |title=National No Bra Day is Officially July 9, 2013...1 Week Countdown |url=http://www.fashionbyhe.com/search?q=no+bra+day |accessdate=September 19, 2018}} Since 2015, the event has only been promoted on October 13. The event was initially described, in part, as:{{cite web |title=National No Bra Day |url=http://nationalnobraday.webs.com |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711064203/http://nationalnobraday.webs.com:80/ |archivedate=July 11, 2011}}{{cite web |title=National No Bra Day |url=https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=174357052696679&set=o.239218809436756&type=3&theater |accessdate=September 19, 2018}} {{quote| Boobies are Fantastic… We all think so. And what better way to express the way we feel than to support a full day of boobie freedom?? ...
Women are magnificent creatures, and so are their breasts. Let us spend the day unleashing boobies from their boobie zoos.
**Breast Cancer is something you should take seriously and be checked for.** }} The announcement was later reposted on a Facebook page promoting the event. October is [[National Breast Cancer Awareness Month]], and by 2014 the official day of the event was moved to October 13, during which women are urged to forgo wearing a bra.{{cite web |title=National No Bra Day – October 13, 2018 |url=https://nationaltoday.com/national-no-bra-day/ |website=National Today |accessdate=September 21, 2018 |date=October 13, 2018}}{{cite web |title=No Bra Day- lose your breast support to support breast cancer awareness |url=http://www.mashupcorner.com/no-bra-day-lose-breast-support-support-breast-cancer-awareness/ |website=Mashupcorner |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |date=August 10, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://en.protothema.gr/national-no-bra-day-against-cancer-photos/|title='National No Bra Day' against cancer (photos) |date=October 13, 2016}} An increasing number of women, especially [[millennials]], have expressed opposition to and are giving up wearing bras.{{cite web |last1=Mallenbaum |first1=Carly |title=Why Millennials are going braless |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/2016/07/19/braless-millenials-bralette/87111292/ |website=USA TODAY |accessdate=September 20, 2018 |language=en |date=July 19, 2016}} === Participation === In 2012, about 400,000 individuals took part, 250,000 of those on Facebook. As of 2017 the day was observed by women in 30 countries,{{cite web |last1=Mitchell |first1=Laura |title=Women everywhere are whipping their bras off today – this is the reason why |url=https://www.dailystar.co.uk/fashion-beauty/651890/No-Bra-Day-breast-cancer-symptoms-signs-awareness-month |website=Dailystar.co.uk |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |language=en |date=October 13, 2017}} including New Zealand, Romania, Malaysia, Scotland, India, and Ghana.{{cite web|url=https://minnambalam.com/k/2016/10/15/1476469828|title=பெண்கள் மார்புக்கச்சை அணியாத தினம்!|website=மின்னம்பலம் |language=ms}}{{cite web |title=NO BRA DAY JULY 9 2012 |url=https://diversityhuman.com/hollywood/Friend-Blogs/national-no-bra-day-july-2012 |website=diversityhuman.com |accessdate=September 16, 2018}}{{cite web |title=Ghanaians Go Braless To Celebrate World 'No Bra Day' (PHOTOS) |url=https://thelead.com.gh/2017/10/14/ghanaians-go-braless-to-celebrate-world-no-bra-dayphotos/ |website=thelead.com.gh |accessdate=September 16, 2018}}{{cite web |title=National No Bra Day |url=https://diversityhuman.com/hollywood/2012/07/04/no-bra-day-july-2012 |website=diversityhuman.com |accessdate=September 16, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://noizz.ro/connected/no-bra-day-bucurestencele-s-au-lasat-fotografiate-fara-sutien/74lp7yx|title=No Bra Day: bucureștencele s-au lăsat fotografiate fără sutien|date=October 13, 2017|language=ro}} Women are urged after taking off their bra to give themselves a breast exam.{{cite web |title=Today is 'National No Bra Day' to Raise Awareness for Breast Cancer – Celebrate Accordingly|url=http://www.thenewportbuzz.com/today-is-national-no-bra-day-to-raise-awareness-for-breast-cancer-celebrate-accordingly/4411 |website=Newport Buzz |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |date=October 13, 2015}} On social media, women are encouraged to go braless and to post photos using the hashtag #nobraday.{{cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/no-bra-day-backlash-twitter_us_561d2919e4b028dd7ea531a0|title=Why 'No Bra Day' Is So Problematic, As Explained By Twitter|first=Willa|last=Frej|date=October 13, 2015|publisher=|via=Huff Post}} More than 82,000 women posted pictures on Twitter and Instagram in 2017.{{cite web |title=Today Is 'No Bra Day'—Here's Why People Are Pissed About It |url=https://www.womenshealthmag.com/health/a19947644/no-bra-day/ |website=Women's Health |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |date=October 13, 2017}} Women who choose not to go braless and men are encouraged to wear something purple on that day. Some sites suggest that participants donate to breast cancer charities.{{cite web |title=No Bra Day 2017 is TODAY! What is it and why is it celebrated? |url=http://effiezy.com/2017/10/13/no-bra-day-2017-is-today-what-is-it-and-why-is-it-celebrated/ |website=Effiezy.com |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |date=October 13, 2017}} A Romanian photographer capitalized on the idea and published an album of photos depicting braless women. === Impact on fashion === Many celebrities world-wide have been seen braless in public for a number of years.{{cite web |last1=Towett |first1=Lorraine |title=6 East African celebs who’ve stepped out braless |url=https://www.pulselive.co.ke/entertainment/east-african-celebs-who-have-stepped-out-without-bras-on-id8239273.html |publisher=Pulse Live |accessdate=October 8, 2018}}{{cite web |last1=Gustashaw |first1=Megan |title=Celebs to World: Going Braless Is NBD |url=https://www.glamour.com/story/the-celebrity-braless-trend |website=Glamour |accessdate=October 8, 2018 |language=en}}{{cite web |title=70 Times Celebrities Went Braless In Honor Of National No Bra Day |url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/red-carpet-dresses/g12838377/celebrities-going-bra-free/ |website=Harper's BAZAAR |accessdate=October 8, 2018 |date=October 13, 2017}} A increasing number of women are following their example. Fewer women are buying push-up style bras. Some are choosing an unstructured, wireless soft cup bralette, and some choose to go bra free altogether. [[Victoria's Secret]]'s parent company L Brands Inc. derives about one-third of its earnings from bras, and in 2016, its revenues were down nearly 30%. Capitalizing on the trend, companies had begun offering clothing designed to advertise that the wearer is not wearing a bra, or fashions designed to take advantage of the no bra look.{{cite web |title=30 Outfits That’ll Inspire You to Ditch Your Bra for Good |url=http://stylecaster.com/no-bra-outfits/ |website=StyleCaster |accessdate=October 8, 2018 |date=October 13, 2015}}{{cite web |title=The Original NO BRA CLUB crop |url=https://thenobraclub.com/products/no-bra-club-crop |website=NO BRA CLUB |accessdate=October 8, 2018 |language=en}} Some women choose to go braless to wear fashions that would otherwise expose straps and to create a streamlined silhouette.{{cite web |last1=Eggertsen |first1=Lauren |title=It's Official: The No-Bra Movement Has Taken Over |url=https://www.whowhatwear.co.uk/no-bra-trend/slide3 |website=Who What Wear UK |accessdate=October 8, 2018 |language=en}} === No official sponsorship === The unofficial No Bra Day is not recognized by any cancer research organization or is formally part of National Breast Cancer Awareness Month.{{cite web |first1= Clementine |last1=Ford |title=Sexualising breast cancer awareness campaigns |url=http://www.dailylife.com.au/news-and-views/dl-opinion/sexualising-breast-cancer-awareness-campaigns-20131010-2vaef.html |website=Daily Life |accessdate=September 23, 2018 |language=en-au}}{{cite web|url=https://metro.co.uk/2015/10/13/today-is-nobraday-and-heres-why-its-become-completely-self-absorbed-and-offensive-5437445/|title=Today is #NoBraDay – and it's become completely self absorbed and offensive|date=October 13, 2015|publisher=}} Some critics have described the event as being "purely sexual".{{citeweb|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/national-no-bra-day-draws-upset-slammed-purely-sexual-article-1.2396222|title=National No Bra Day draws upset from critics who slam the event as purely sexual|accessdate=October 8, 2017}} The event does not directly raise money for cancer research or prevention, although individuals are in some cases encouraged to support such causes.{{cite web |last1=Wallwork |first1=Ellen |title=This Is What Happened When We Tried To Find Out Who Started 'No Bra Day' |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/no-bra-day_uk_59e092eae4b0a52aca170f18 |website=HuffPost UK |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |date=October 13, 2017}} === Feminist connection === Some participants connect not wearing a bra to feminist protests like those at the 1968 [[Miss America protest]]. There, protesters symbolically threw a number of feminine products including bras into a "Freedom Trash Can".{{cite journal|last=Dow|first=Bonnie J.|year=2003|title=Feminism, Miss America, and Media Mythology|url=http://www.public.asu.edu/~kleong/missamericacommodificationfeminist.pdf|journal=Rhetoric & Public Affairs|volume=6|issue=1|pages=127–149|doi=10.1353/rap.2003.0028|issn=1094-8392|jstor=41939812|access-date=January 16, 2014}} They described the items as "instruments of female torture"{{cite magazine |last=Duffett |first=Judith |date=October 1968 |title=WLM vs. Miss America |work=Voice of the Women's Liberation Movement |page=4}} and accouterments of what they perceived to be enforced [[femininity]]. The protest gained notoriety when a local news story in the Atlantic City ''Press'' erroneously reported that "the bras, girdles, falsies, curlers, and copies of popular women's magazines" were burned.{{cite news|last=Boucher |first=John L. |title=Bra-Burners Blitz Boardwalk |work=Atlantic City Press |date=September 8, 1968}}{{cite book |last=Campbell|first=W. Joseph|year=2010|title=Getting It Wrong: Ten of the Greatest Misreported Stories in American Journalism|location=Berkeley, California|publisher=University of California Press|isbn=978-0-520-26209-6}}{{rp|109–110}} Some feminist activists believe that [[Antifeminism|anti-feminists]] used the protesters' suggestion of going braless to trivialize what the women were trying to accomplish and to minimize the importance of the feminist movement in general.{{cite web |last=Lee |first=Jennifer |date=June 11, 2014 |title=Feminism Has a Bra-Burning Myth Problem |url=http://time.com/2853184/feminism-has-a-bra-burning-myth-problem |website=Time |location=New York |access-date=August 24, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180723220901/http://time.com/2853184/feminism-has-a-bra-burning-myth-problem/ |archive-date=July 23, 2018 |dead-url=no }}{{cite journal|last=Dow|first=Bonnie J.|year=1999|title=Spectacle, Spectatorship, and Gender Anxiety in Television News Coverage of the 1970 Women's Strike for Equality|work=Communication Studies|volume=50|issue=2|pages=143–157|doi=10.1080/10510979909388481|issn=1745-1035}}{{cite web|url=http://www.snopes.com/history/american/burnbra.htm |title=Red Hot Mamas (bra-burning) |publisher=Snopes.com Urban Legends}} Some feminists who support the idea of using No Bra Day to raise awareness of breast cancer are concerned with the sexualization of the #nobraday hashtag in social media.{{cite web |last1=Albala |first1=Samantha |title=National No Bra Day: Is Everyone Missing The Point? |url=https://bust.com/tv/13140-national-no-bra-day-is-everyone-missing-the-point.html |website=bust.com |accessdate=September 21, 2018 |language=en-gb}} In the Philippines, the observance is seen as a day to advance the cause of [[gender equality]]. One journalist supported No Bra Day, saying that it "asserts femininity and our appreciation of who we are as a woman... The bra symbolizes how women are being held in bondage".{{cite web |title=Feminists take bras off to call for freedom |url=http://mindanaogoldstardaily.com/feminists-take-bras-off-to-call-for-freedom/ |website=mindanaogoldstardaily.com |accessdate=September 19, 2018}} The observance and its connections to gender equality has drawn comparisons with the Go Topless women's rights movement and [[Go Topless Day]], a protest in which women assert their legal right to go both braless and shirtless.{{cite web |title=Battle of the bra|work= Global Times |url=http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/1067566.shtml |first=Zhang |last1=Xinyuan |accessdate=October 7, 2018}}{{cite web |title=Why more women are freeing their breasts by going braless |url=https://globalnews.ca/news/2837056/why-more-women-are-freeing-their-breasts-by-going-braless/ |website=Global News |accessdate=October 7, 2018 |language=en}}{{cite web|last=Awesome|first=Barb|title=It's National GoTopless Day!|url=http://www.chicagonow.com/thats-awesome/2011/08/its-national-gotopless-day/|publisher= [[ChicagoNow]] |accessdate= April 3, 2012|date=August 21, 2011}}{{cite web |last1=holly.michels@lee.net |first1=Holly Michels |title=Helena student not wearing bra turns into issue of gender inequality |url=https://mtstandard.com/news/local/helena-student-not-wearing-bra-turns-into-issue-of-gender/article_4e1bfad0-65c9-5f9d-98a4-872c9a1063aa.html |website=Montana Standard |accessdate=October 7, 2018 |language=en}} == Criticism == Going braless during the current decade has according to some been politicized by No Bra Day, and the association between going braless and breast cancer screening has drawn criticism.{{cite web |title=#NoBraDay is a gross hashtag aimed at 'raising breast cancer awareness' |url=https://www.dailydot.com/irl/no-bra-day-hashtag/ |website=The Daily Dot |accessdate=September 19, 2018 |date=October 13, 2014}}{{citeweb|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/you-joining-no-bra-day-6623697|title=Are you joining in 'No Bra Day' today? The breast cancer awareness day may not be all it seems|accessdate=October 8, 2017}}[http://www.heraldscotland.com/opinion/15583121.Vicky_Allan__Keep_your_bras_on__ladies__That_selfie_won__39_t_stop_cancer_/ Keep your bras on, ladies. That selfie won't stop cancer] ''[[Scotland Herald]]'' Retrieved October 8, 2017 === Sexualization vs. disease === The tabloid website [[TMZ]] posted an item about "Happy No Bra Day" with an image of [[Selena Gomez]] wearing a see-through top. Another site featured a photo gallery titled "#NoBraDay: 15 Celebs Who Frolick About With Their Fun Bags Freed".{{cite web |last1=KATZ |first1=LESLIE |title='Very distasteful': Not everyone supports #NoBraDay |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/ditch-the-bra-says-controversial-nobraday/ |website=CNET |accessdate=September 23, 2018 |language=en |date=October 13, 2015}} One of the issues with the concept is that breast cancer survivors who use [[prosthesis|prosthetics]] must wear a bra to conceal their disfigurement or wear prosthetics and inserts in their bra to make them appear "normal".{{cite web|url=https://roodepoortrecord.co.za/2017/10/13/national-no-bra-day-2/|title=National No Bra Day |work= Roodepoort Record|date=October 13, 2017|publisher=}} Some critics have described the event as sexualizing and exploiting women’s bodies while at the same time belittling a serious disease.{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/you-joining-no-bra-day-6623697|title=Are you joining in 'No Bra Day' today? The breast cancer awareness day may not be all it seems|accessdate=October 8, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/opinion/15583121.Vicky_Allan__Keep_your_bras_on__ladies__That_selfie_won__39_t_stop_cancer_/ |title=Keep your bras on, ladies. That selfie won't stop cancer |publisher=Scotland Herald|accessdate= October 8, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/national-no-bra-day-draws-upset-slammed-purely-sexual-article-1.2396222|title=National No Bra Day draws upset from critics who slam the event as purely sexual|accessdate=October 8, 2017}} Jean Sachs, CEO of Living Beyond Breast Cancer, thinks No Bra Day is offensive. "I mean breast cancer is a life-threatening illness. It has nothing to do with wearing a bra or not wearing a bra." Gayle Sulik, founder and executive director of the Breast Cancer Consortium, said, "But we don't really pay attention to what's going on with breast cancer. That's a hugely damaging impact of this sort of message".{{cite web |last1=Dupere |first1=Katie |title=#NoBraDay forgets that women are more than their boobies |url=https://mashable.com/2015/10/13/nobraday-breast-cancer/ |website=Mashable |accessdate=September 21, 2018 |language=en}} In New Zealand, the New Zealand Breast Cancer Foundation attempted to repeat the success of a Scottish television breast cancer awareness campaign that educated women about the appearance of their breasts. It featured comedienne Elaine C. Smith showing pictures of typical breasts displaying cancer symptoms.{{cite web |title=Elaine C Smith stars in Scottish Government breast cancer campaign created by The Leith Agency |url=https://www.thedrum.com/news/2012/09/04/elaine-c-smith-stars-scottish-government-breast-cancer-campaign-created-leith-agency |website=The Drum |accessdate=September 23, 2018 |language=en}} But New Zealand's Commercial Approval Bureau would have likely given the ad showing breasts and nipples for medical purposes an Adults Only classification, requiring it to be broadcast after 8:30 pm.{{cite web |last1=Bond |first1=Anthony |title=Images from advert responsible for 50% rise in women seeing GP about breast cancer BANNED in New Zealand |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/images-advert-responsible-50-rise-2322952 |website=mirror |accessdate=September 23, 2018 |date=September 30, 2013}} The Breast Cancer Foundation opted to place objects strategically in front of the nipples instead. === Personal decision === One writer criticized the Facebook site's message "P.S. Ladies…. Wearing a white t-shirt on this day is not only acceptable, but encouraged!" as objectifying women's bodies. Some women resist the attempt to politicize their decision to not wear a bra or fetishize their breasts for a cause. One woman commented, "The reason is that I tried being braless, and I liked it better. It wasn't a political decision, except insofar as everything a woman does with her body that isn't letting someone else dictate what she ought to do with it is a political decision".{{cite web |last1=Brenhouse |first1=Hillary |title=The Joy of Not Wearing a Bra |url=https://www.newyorker.com/culture/personal-history/the-joy-of-not-wearing-a-bra |website=The New Yorker |accessdate=September 15, 2018 |date=October 26, 2017}}{{cite |last1=Epstein |first1=Ben |title=Political Choice |website=Oxford Scholarship Online |doi=10.1093/oso/9780190698980.003.0004 |date=April 19, 2018}} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [https://www.wessexcancer.org.uk/national-no-bra-day Wessex Cancer Trust website] [[Category:Cancer awareness]] [[Category:Public awareness campaigns]] [[Category:International observances]] [[Category:Feminism and history]] [[Category:Brassieres]] [[Category:21st-century fashion]]

revision.text:
[[Image:П. Ф. Лесгафт (фото конца XIX в.).jpg|right|thumb|Peter Lesgaft]] '''Peter Franzevich Lesgaft''' ({{lang-ru|Пётр Францевич Лесгафт}}) (21 September 1837 – 1909) was a [[Russia]]n [[teacher]], [[anatomist]], [[physician]] and social reformer. He was the founder of the modern system of physical education and medical-pedagogical control in physical training, one of founders of theoretical anatomy. [[Lesgaft National State University of Physical Education, Sport and Health]] in [[St. Petersburg]] is named after him. Unity and integrity of all organs in human body was the basis of '''Peter Lesgaft''' system of the pointed exercises for both physical development and intellectual, moral and [[aesthetic]] education.
Outdoor games were his favorite means in both physical development and formation of character of a child. == Biography == '''Peter Lesgaft''' was born on 21 September 1837 in [[Sankt-Petersburg]], the third son of a jeweler of German descent. In 1861 he graduated from Imperial Medical-Surgical Academy in St. Petersburg and remained there as a teacher of anatomy. In 1869 he became a professor at the University of Kazan, but soon was barred from teaching for his outspoken criticism of the unscientific methods used. In 1872 he became consultant on therapeutic gymnastics in the private practice of Dr. Berglindt. In 1872-1874 he supervised a group of Russian women for the first time allowed to employment in the Imperial Medical-Surgical Academy. He also became known for publication of a descriptive history of sport in Europe and ancient Greece and an article on naturalistic gymnastics. As a result, he was put in charge of the physical training of military cadets. In 1875, he was sponsored by the Russian Military Ministry to spend two summers in Western Europe, studying the systems of physical education. During that time he visited 26 cities in 13 European countries. He carefully studied British system visiting English public schools, the Central Army Gymnastics School at [[Aldershot]], the Royal Military Academy at [[Woolwich]] and [[Oxford University]]. In 1877, he published ‘‘Relationship of Anatomy to Physical Education'' and ‘‘The Major Purpose of Physical Education in Schools''. He was able to organizing courses for physical education instructors for the military academies — until then non-existent. In 1893 '''Peter Lesgaft''' organized Biological laboratory which in 1918 was transformed into P.F.Lesgaft Institute of Natural Science.
==External links == {{commonscat|Peter Lesgaft}} *[http://kazan.ws/cgi-bin/eng/view.pl?a=fa&id=512&mr=4&idr=87 Peter Lesgaft short biography and photo] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060904060637/http://www.educ.uidaho.edu/center_for_ethics/About%20Us/PSlesgaft.htm The Founder of Russian Physical Education] By James Riordan [[University of Bradford]], [[England]]
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lesgaff, Peter Franzevich}} [[Category:Russian anatomists]] [[Category:Imperial Russian physicians]] [[Category:1837 births]] [[Category:1909 deaths]] [[Category:Lesgaft University]] [[Category:Social reformers]]

revision.text:
{{short description|Ancient Greek god of fertility and male genitalia}} {{about||the ancient city in Asia Minor|Karabiga|a genus of sea anemones|Actinia}} {{Infobox deity | type = Greek | name = Priapus | image = Pompeya erótica6.jpg | alt = | caption = Fresco of Priapus, [[House of the Vettii]], [[Pompeii]] | god_of = God of fertility, vegetables, nature, livestock, fruit, beekeeping, sex, genitals, masculinity, and gardens | abode = | symbol = Donkey, flowers, fruit, vegetables, fish, bees | consort = | parents = [[Aphrodite]] and [[Dionysus]];
[[Hermes]] and Aphrodite;
Dionysus and [[Chione (daughter of Boreas)|Chione]];
[[Zeus]] and Aphrodite
[[Pan (god)|Pan]] | siblings = [[Charites]], [[Eros]], [[Hermaphroditos]], [[Hymenaios]], [[Pan (god)|Pan]], [[satyrs]] | children = | mount = | Roman_equivalent = [[Mutunus Tutunus]] }} In [[Greek mythology]], '''Priapus''' ({{IPAc-en|p|r|aɪ|ˈ|eɪ|p|ə|s}};{{cite web|url=http://www.collinsdictionary.com/dictionary/english/priapus?showCookiePolicy=true|title=Priapus |accessdate=24 September 2014|publisher=Collins Dictionary|date=n.d.}} {{lang-grc|Πρίηπος}}, {{grc-transl|Πρίηπος}}) was a minor rustic fertility god, protector of [[livestock]], fruit plants, gardens and male [[genitalia]]. Priapus is marked by his oversized, permanent [[erection]], which gave rise to the medical term [[priapism]]. He became a popular figure in [[Erotic art in Pompeii and Herculaneum|Roman erotic art]] and [[Latin literature]], and is the subject of the often humorously obscene collection of verse called the ''[[Priapeia]]''. ==Relationship with other deities== Priapus was described as the son of [[Aphrodite]] by [[Dionysus]], or the son of Dionysus and [[Chione (daughter of Boreas)|Chione]],[[Scholia]] on [[Theocritus]], 1. 21 perhaps as the father or son of [[Hermes]],Kerenyi, ''Gods of the Greeks'', 1951, p. 175, noting G. Kaibel, ''Epigrammata graeca ex lapidibus collecta'', 817, where the other god's name, both father and son of Hermes, is obscured; [[Hyginus]] (''Fabulae'' 160) makes Hermes the father of Pan. and the son of [[Zeus]] or [[Pan (mythology)|Pan]], depending on the source."Priapus". ''The Oxford Companion to World Mythology''. David Leeming. Oxford University Press, 2004. According to legend, [[Hera]] cursed him with inconvenient impotence (he could not sustain an erection when the time came for sexual intercourse), ugliness and foul-mindedness while he was still in Aphrodite's womb, in revenge for the hero [[Paris (mythology)|Paris]] having the temerity to judge Aphrodite more beautiful than Hera.An elaboration on a ''[[scholium]]'' on [[Apollonius of Rhodes]]' ''Argonautica'' i. Kereny remarks of the jealousy of Hera in this case, "a cheap theme, and certainly not an ancient one" (Kerenyi 1951, p.176). The other gods refused to allow him to live on [[Mount Olympus]] and threw him down to Earth, leaving him on a hillside. He was eventually found by shepherds and was brought up by them. Priapus joined Pan and the [[satyr]]s as a spirit of fertility and growth, though he was perennially frustrated by his impotence. In a ribald anecdote told by Ovid,Ovid, ''[[Fasti (poem)|Fasti]]'', vi.319ff he attempted to rape the goddess [[Hestia]] but was thwarted by an [[donkey|ass]], whose braying caused him to lose his erection at the critical moment and woke Hestia. The episode gave him a lasting hatred of asses and a willingness to see them destroyed in his honour."Priapus." ''Who's Who in Classical Mythology'', Routledge. 2002. The emblem of his lustful nature was his permanent [[erection]] and his large penis. Another myth states that he pursued the nymph [[Lotis (mythology)|Lotis]] until the gods took pity on her and turned her into a [[lotus tree|lotus]] plant."Priapus." ''Bloomsbury Dictionary of Myth''. 1996. ==Worship and attributes== [[File:Pompeya erótica5.jpg|thumb|225px|Priapus depicted with the attributes of [[Mercury (mythology)|Mercury]] in a fresco found at Pompeii]] The first extant mention of Priapus is in the eponymous comedy ''Priapus'', written in the 4th century BC by [[Xenarchus]]. Originally worshipped by Greek colonists in [[Lampsacus]] in [[Asia Minor]], the cult of Priapus spread to mainland Greece and eventually to Italy during the 3rd century BC.Robert Christopher Towneley Parker. "Priapus". ''The Oxford Classical Dictionary.'' Ed. Simon Hornblower and Anthony Spawforth. Oxford University Press 2003. [[Lucian]] (''De saltatione'') tells that in [[Bithynia]] Priapus was accounted as a warlike god, a rustic tutor to the infant [[Ares]], "who taught him dancing first and war only afterwards," [[Karl Kerenyi]] observed.Kerenyi, ''Gods of the Greeks'', 1951, p. 154, also pp. 175–77. . [[Arnobius]] is aware of the importance accorded Priapus in this region near the [[Hellespont]].In ridiculing the literal aspects of pagan gods given human form, he mentions "the Hellespontian Priapus bearing about among the goddesses, virgin and matron, those parts ever prepared for encounter." (Arnobius, ''Seven Books against the Heathen'' III.10 ([http://www.intratext.com/IXT/ENG1008/_P3.HTM on-line text]). Also, Pausanias notes: {{quote|This god is worshipped where goats and sheep pasture or there are swarms of bees; but by the people of Lampsacus he is more revered than any other god, being called by them a son of Dionysus and Aphrodite.Pausanias, ''Description of Greece'' [http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Paus.+9.31.2 9.31.2].}} In later antiquity, his worship meant little more than a cult of sophisticated pornography.Mark P.O. Morford, Robert J. Lenardon, Michael Sham. (2011, 9th ed.). "Classical Mythology" (New York, NY.: Oxford University Press) {{ISBN|978-0-19-539770-3}} Outside his "home" region in Asia Minor, Priapus was regarded as something of a joke by urban dwellers. However, he played a more important role in the countryside, where he was seen as a guardian deity. He was regarded as the patron god of sailors and fishermen and others in need of good luck, and his presence was believed to avert the [[evil eye]]."Priapus." Encyclopædia Britannica. 2007 Priapus does not appear to have had an organized cult and was mostly worshiped in gardens or homes, though there are attestations of temples dedicated to the god. His sacrificial animal was the [[ass (animal)|ass]], but agricultural offerings (such as fruit, flowers, vegetables and fish) were also very common. Long after the fall of Rome and the rise of [[Christianity]], Priapus continued to be invoked as a symbol of health and fertility. The 13th century [[Lanercost Chronicle]], a history of northern England and Scotland, records a "lay [[Cistercian]] brother" erecting a statue of Priapus (''simulacrum Priapi statuere'') in an attempt to end an outbreak of cattle disease.Yves Bonnefoy, ''Roman and European Mythologies'', pp. 139–142. University of Chicago Press, 1992. {{ISBN|0-226-06455-7}} In the 1980s, D. F. Cassidy founded the [[St. Priapus Church]] as a modern church centred on worship of the [[phallus]].[[J. Gordon Melton]] (1996, 5th ed.). ''Encyclopedia of American Religions'' (Detroit, Mich.: Gale) {{ISBN|0-8103-7714-4}} p. 952.Andy Nyberg, "St. Priapus Church: The Organized Religion", ''[[The Advocate (LGBT magazine)|The Advocate]]'', Sep. 1983, pp. 35–37. ==Depictions== [[File:Musée Picardie Archéo 03.jpg|thumb|upright|225px|[[Gallo-Roman culture|Gallo-Roman]] bronze statuette (ca 1st century CE) of Priapus (or a [[Hooded Spirits|Genius cucullatus?]]) discovered in [[Picardy]], northern France, made in two parts, with the top section concealing a giant phallus.]] Priapus' iconic attribute was his [[priapism]] (permanently erect [[penis]]); he probably absorbed some pre-existing [[phallus|ithyphallic]] deities as his cult developed. He was represented in a variety of ways, most commonly as a misshapen gnome-like figure with an enormous erect phallus. Statues of Priapus were common in ancient Greece and Rome, standing in gardens. The [[Athens|Athenians]] often conflated Priapus with [[Hermes]], the god of boundaries, and depicted a hybrid deity with a winged helmet, sandals, and huge erection. Another attribute of Priapus was the sickle which he often carries in his right hand. This too was used to threaten thieves, doubtless with castration:[[Lloyd deMause|deMause, Lloyd]] (ed.) (1976), ''The History of Childhood'', p. 46.For the sickle used for the castration of sacrificial animals, see Burkert, Walter (1983) ''Homo Necans: The Anthropology of Ancient Greek Ritual and Myth'', translated by Peter Bing, p. 68, quoting Martial 3.24. Horace (''Sat.'' 1.8.1–7) writes:Moul, V. A. (2016). [https://kclpure.kcl.ac.uk/portal/files/57785240/source_for_priapus_cowley_note.pdf "The Source for Priapus in Cowley’s Ode “To The Royal Society” (1667)"], p. 3. :''Olim truncus eram ficulnus, inutile lignum,
cum faber, incertus scamnum faceretne Priapum,
maluit esse deum. deus inde ego, furum aviumque
maxima formido; nam fures dextra coercet
obscenoque ruber porrectus ab inguine palus;
ast importunes volucres in vertice harundo
terret fixa vetatque novis considere in hortis.'' :"Once I was a trunk of fig, a useless piece of wood,
when a carpenter, unsure whether he should make a bench or a Priapus,
decided to make a god. So I am a god, of thieves and birds
a very great scarer; for my right hand curbs thieves,
as does the red pole which projects from my indecent groin;
but as for the importunate birds, the reed fixed on my head
terrifies them and forbids them to settle in the new gardens." A number of [[epigram]]s, apparently written as if to adorn shrines of Priapus, were collected in the ''[[Priapeia]]''. In these, Priapus frequently threatens sexual assault against potential thieves:Craig A. Williams, ''Roman Homosexuality: Ideologies of Masculinity in Classical Antiquity'', [https://books.google.com/books?id=STP5BgAAQBAJ&pg=PT46 p. 21]. Oxford University Press US, 1999. {{ISBN|0-19-512505-3}} :''Percidere, puer, moneo; futuere, puella;
   barbatum furem tertia poena manet.'' :"I warn you, boy, you will be screwed; girl, you will be laid with;
   a third penalty awaits the bearded thief." :''Femina si furtum faciet mihi virve puerve,
   haec cunnum, caput hic praebeat, ille nates. :"If a woman steals from me, or a man, or a boy,
   let the first give me her cunt, the second his head, the third his buttocks." :''per medios ibit pueros mediasque puellas
   mentula; barbatis non-nisi summa petet.'' :"My dick will go through the middle of boys and the middle of girls,
   but with bearded men it will aim only for the top." A number of Roman paintings of Priapus have survived. One of the most famous images of Priapus is that from the [[House of the Vettii]] in [[Pompeii]]. A [[fresco]] depicts the god weighing his phallus against a large bag of coins. In nearby [[Herculaneum]], an excavated snack bar has a painting of Priapus behind the bar, apparently as a good-luck symbol for the customers.{{citation needed|date=February 2014}} ==In literature== As well as the collection known as the ''[[Priapeia]]'' mentioned above, Priapus was a frequent figure in Latin erotic or mythological verse. In [[Ovid]]'s ''[[Fasti (poem)|Fasti]]'',Fasti, 6.319ff. the [[nymph]] [[Lotis (mythology)|Lotis]] fell into a drunken slumber at a feast, and Priapus seized this opportunity to advance upon her. With stealth he approached, and just before he could embrace her, [[Silenus]]'s donkey alerted the party with "raucous braying". Lotis awoke and pushed Priapus away, but her only true escape was to be transformed into the [[lotus tree]]. To punish the donkey for spoiling his opportunity, Priapus bludgeoned it to death with his gargantuan phallus. In later versions of the story, Lotis is replaced with the virginal goddess [[Hestia]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}} Ovid's anecdote served to explain why donkeys were sacrificed to Priapus in the city of [[Lampsacus]] on the Hellespont, where he was worshipped among the offspring of [[Hermes]].[[Gaius Julius Hyginus|Hyginus]], ''Fabulae'', 160. Priapus is repeatedly mentioned in Petronius's ''[[Satyricon]]''. William Arrowsmith, in the introduction and notes to his translation of the work, draws parallels between his hounding of the protagonist and that of [[Poseidon]] in Homer's ''[[Odyssey]]''. Priapus is mentioned in Geoffrey Chaucer's "[[The Merchant's Tale]]", part of ''[[The Canterbury Tales]]''. During a description of a garden that the protagonist, Januarie, creates, Priapus is invoked in his form as God of gardens:
Ne Priapus ne myghte nat suffise, Though he be God of gardyns, for to telle The beautee of the gardyn and the welle, That stood under a laurer alwey grene.G. Chaucer, ''The Merchant's Prologue and Tale'', (Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 2006), p63 (Priapus might not suffice, Though he be god of gardens, to tell Of the beauty of the garden and the well That stood under the laurel, always green.)
Priapus serves to remind the reader, or listening audience, that Januarie's intentions are driven by lust and not love. Priapus is mentioned in [[William Carlos Williams]]'s poem "[[Paterson (poem)|Paterson]]". Priapus is also mentioned in John Steinbeck's ''[[East of Eden (novel)|East of Eden]]'': "She conducted her house like a cathedral dedicated to a sad but erect Priapus." [[T.S. Eliot]] refers to Priapus in his poem "Mr. Appolinax" (published in ''Prufrock and Other Observations'', 1920): "When Mr. Apollinax visited the United States / His laughter tinkled among the teacups. / I thought of Fragilion, that shy figure among the birch-trees,/ And of Priapus in the shrubbery / Gaping at the lady in the swing." Priapus is also mentioned in Vladimir Nabokov's ''[[Invitation to a Beheading]]'': "Or when you, with eyes closed tight, devouring a spurting peach and then, having finished, but still swallowing, with your mouth still full, you cannibal, your glazed eyes wandered, your fingers were spread, your inflamed lips were all glossy, your chin trembled, all covered with drops of the cloudy juice, which trickled down onto your bared bosom, while the Priapus who had nourished you suddenly, with a convulsive oath, turned his back to me, who had entered the room at the wrong moment." Priap[us] is mentioned as well in Nabokov's ''[[Lolita]]'': "She was the loveliest nymphet green-red-blue Priap himself could think up". == Patron of merchant sailing == Priapus' role as a patron god for merchant sailors in ancient Greece and Rome is that of a protector and navigational aide. Recent shipwreck evidence contains apotropaic items carried onboard by mariners in the forms of a terracotta phallus, wooden Priapus figure, and bronze sheath from a military ram. Coinciding with the use of wooden Priapic markers erected in areas of dangerous passage or particular landing areas for sailors, the function of Priapus is much more extensive than previously thought.Neilson III, Harry R. 2002. "A terracotta phallus from Pisa Ship E: more evidence for the Priapus deity as protector of Greek and Roman navigators." ''The International Journal of Nautical Archaeology'' 31.2: 248–253. Although Priapus is commonly associated with the failed attempts of [[rape]] against the nymphs Lotis and Vesta in Ovid's comedy FastiFantham, Elaine. 1983. "Sexual Comedy in Ovid's Fasti: Sources and Motivation." ''Harvard Studies in Classical Philology'' 87: 185. and the rather flippant treatment of the deity in urban settings, Priapus' protection traits can be traced back to the importance placed on the [[phallus]] in ancient times (particularly his association with fertility and garden protection). In Greece, the phallus was thought of to have a mind of its own, animal-like, separate from the mind and control of the man.Csapo, Eric. 1997. "Riding the Phallus for Dionysus: Iconology, Ritual, and Gender-Role De/Construction." ''Phoenix'' 51.3/4: 260. The phallus is also associated with "possession and territorial demarcation" in many cultures, attributing to Priapus' other role as a navigational deity. ==Modern derivations== ===Medical terminology=== The medical condition [[priapism]] derives its name from Priapus, alluding to the god's permanently engorged penis. ===Natural history=== * The group of worm-like marine burrowing animals known as the [[Priapulida|Priapulidea]], literally "penis worms", also derives its name from Priapus. * ''[[Mutinus caninus]]'', a woodland fungus, draws its first name from Priapus's Roman name, due to its phallic shape. ===In popular culture=== * It has been suggested by some scholars that the modern popular [[garden gnome]] is a descendant of Priapus.Peter D. Arnott, ''An Introduction to the Roman World.'' London: MacMillan, 1970; Judith Harris, ''Pompeii Awakened: A Story of Rediscovery.'' I.B.Tauris, 2007, p. 117. {{ISBN|1-84511-241-5}}. Hugh Lloyd-Jones, ''Greek in a Cold Climate.'' Rowman & Littlefield, 1991, p. 64. {{ISBN|0-389-20967-8}}. * In [[Sherrilyn Kenyon]]'s ''[[Fantasy Lover]]'', Priapus is Julian's half-brother, who cursed him to live in the book and only come out to be someone's lover from full moon to full moon. * Doujinshi artist Mentaiko wrote a [[Bara (genre)|bara]] [[doujinshi]] [[manga]] inspired by the Priapus mythos in 2011. The manga is currently ongoing.http://www.mangago.me/read-manga/priapus/ * Nicolas Presl interprets the myth in his wordless graphic novel "Priape" (Genève, Atrabile, 2006) * 2014 Indie Game ''A Date in the Park'' uses Priapus as a clue for the main character to find his love interest. ==See also== * [[Priapeia]] * [[Latin obscenity]] * [[Sexuality in ancient Rome]] * [[Karabiga]], Turkey, formerly known as Priapus * [[Richard Payne Knight]] ==References== {{commons category|Priapus}} ===Notes=== {{reflist}} ===Bibliography=== * Brown, Emerson, Jr. "Hortus Inconclusus: The Significance of Priapus and Pyramus and Thisbe in the Merchant's Tale". ''Chaucer Review'' 4.1 (1970): 31–40. * “Priapus and the Parlement of Foulys”. ''Studies in Philology'' 72 (1975): 258–74. * Coronato, Rocco. “The Emergence of Priapism in the Two Gentlemen of Verona”. ''In Proteus: The Language of Metamorphosis'', ed. Carla Dente, George Ferzoco, Miriam Gill and Marina Spunta. Aldershot: Ashgate, 2005, chapter 8, 93–101. * Delord, Frédéric. "[http://www.shakmyth.org/myth/257/priapus Priapus]". 2009. In A Dictionary of Shakespeare's Classical Mythology (2009–), ed. Yves Peyré. * [https://web.archive.org/web/20100525085836/http://www.ircl.cnrs.fr/pdf/King%20Lear/Presentation_PDF/F_Delord.pdf "'O, the difference of man and man!' (IV.ii.26): Références et différences génitales dans King Lear"] in ''Autour de King Lear'', ed. A. Lafont and M.-C. Munoz, with F. Delord. Montpellier: IRCL, February 2009. * ''Érubescences et turgescences dans l’imaginaire shakespearien et la culture de la Renaissance'', thèse dactylographiée (Ph.D). Montpellier : Université Montpellier III – Paul Valéry, 2008. * Franz, David O. "Leud Priapians and Renaissance Pornography". ''Studies in English Literature 1500–1900'' 12, n°1 (winter 1972): 157–72. * Morel, Philippe. "Priape à la Renaissance: Les guirlandes de Giovanni da Udine à la Farnésine". ''Revue de l’Art'' 69 (1985): 13–28. * Peyré, Yves. "Priape dénaturé: Remarques sur les Apotheseos…Deorum Libri Tres de Georges Pictor et leur adaptation anglaise par Stephen Batman". ''Influences latines en Europe'' (Cahiers de l’Europe Classique et Néo-Latine). Toulouse: Travaux de l’Université de Toulouse – Le Mirail, A.23 (1983): 61–87. ==External links== {{Spoken Wikipedia|Priapus.ogg|2010-01-07}} {{Wiktionary-inline|Priapus}} * {{cite EB1911|wstitle=Priāpus}} * [http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/475721/Priapus Britannica Online Encyclopedia] * [http://www.ancientlibrary.com/smith-bio/2855.html Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology] * [http://www.theoi.com/Georgikos/Priapos.html Priapos: Greek & Mysian God of Gardens and Fertility – Theoi Project] {{Roman religion}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Fertility gods]] [[Category:Priapists]] [[Category:Agricultural gods]] [[Category:Offspring of Aphrodite]] [[Category:Offspring of Dionysus]] [[Category:Greek gods]] [[Category:Sexuality in ancient Rome]] [[Category:Phallic symbols]] [[Category:LGBT themes in Greek mythology]]
